page.title: 11EMPLOYMENT (3)
page.content:
Facts from Interview.(Agr-1934 & 1985) _____________________________________
Most machinery was horse drawn (ploughs, cultivators and threshing machines). First tractor was bought in 1940 and cost Â£126 (including a plough). Transportng crops to market in Ely was done by horse and cart and took most of the day. Today machines are common (Combine costs Â£35,000, Tractor Â£18,000) and loading of large articulated lorries is quick (half hour) and easy. The number of men on the land has diminished, one farm (250 acres) from 10 men down to 3 and another farm (2000 acres) down from 87 men to 21.
